title: Building a Healthy Live Service Roadmap
content: We’re shifting to a seasonal model that favors quality over quantity. Each drop will deliver a focused slice of content — one hero feature, one competitive refresh, and one meaningful quality-of-life batch. The goal is simple: every update should feel predictable for your schedule and valuable for your playstyle.

title: Measuring Fairness in Ranked Play
content: Ranked health will be tracked through three lenses: match balance (spread of MMR per lobby), churn after losses, and queue satisfaction time. When any metric drifts, we adjust map pools, matchmaking tolerances, or reward cadence instead of forcing players into longer grinds.

title: Accessibility Checklist for Upcoming Releases
content: Every new feature ships with scalable subtitles, colorblind-safe palettes, remappable inputs, and haptic toggle options. We now run playtests with assistive tech users before content lock so fixes land in the same sprint, not a post-launch hotfix.

title: Optimizing Patch Sizes for Global Players
content: We’re reducing patch weight by splitting media updates from balance tuning. Texture bundles now stream on demand, while code and balance changes stay under 400 MB. This keeps café players and regions with bandwidth caps aligned with day-one access.

title: Narrative Pillars for 2026 Story Arcs
content: Our next arc focuses on agency and consequence. Players will see supporting characters react to resource choices, alliances, and failed quests instead of fixed dialogue trees. Seasonal side stories will wrap in under 90 minutes so casual players can stay current without grind pressure.

title: Player Safety: What Changes Next Season
content: Voice chat now defaults to friends-only for new accounts, profanity filters are on by default, and real-time reporting routes clips to human moderation during peak events. Trust scores decay faster after verified reports to keep repeat offenders out of social spaces.
